data.title: Contributions to the tribute of Michael Blake
data.meta_description: Contributions to the tribute of Michael Blake.
data.text:
Loading...

B

BRIAN ALLISON posted a symbolic gesture

//s3.amazonaws.com/skins.funeraltechweb.com/tribute-gestures/v2/hockey.png

I was very sad to hear of Mike's passing. Many years ago, my young son began collecting autographs from NHL players. The players he most wanted to meet were players that were from our home town of Kitchener-Waterloo. In 2011, I was able to contact Mike through a mutual friend. Not only was Mike willing to sign an autograph for a young fan, but he welcomed my son and I into his home to see his hockey memorabilia and hear stories from his playing days. What a rare privilege! I didn't know Mike well. However, one can learn a great deal about a person by seeing the kindness they extend to strangers. I imagine it must have been a gift to call Mike a friend; a father; a son; a husband; a teammate. To those who were fortunate enough to know him, my deepest condolences. As for my son and I, we will always cherish the memory of meeting Mike! Brian Allison

Please wait

Gary Laskoski posted a condolence

I was so saddened to hear of Mike's passing. Let me offer my heartfelt condolences to Mike's family and friends. I was a fellow goaltender with Mike in LA for a few years and Mike was such a great person - truly one of the very best! Mike will be missed dearly and I cherish my memories of him. Gary Laskoski

Duncan and Tobi Hamilton posted a condolence

Janice, Christopher, Meghan and Natalie. Mike was one special guy. His smile filled a room. His laughter was infectious. His kindness unbound. So many memories together that will keep him in our hearts forever. We'll miss him dearly. Love always, Duncan & Tobi

Ian McLean posted a condolence

Many fond memories of playing golf at Westmount with Mike. Such a gentleman- funny, warm and kind. He would always talk about family - what a great life he had and how proud he was of the kids. I’ll miss his smile and warm nature. My prayer for the family is that God will comfort you all in the palm of his gentle, healing hands. Blessings and peace.

Cori Dietrich posted a condolence

Janice, we are so sorry. Although we haven't seen Mike for many years, we feel one could never find a more genuine person. Please know our thoughts are with you and your family. Doug and Cori Dietrich

Joe Pavia posted a condolence

Janice and family, we are so sorry to hear of Mike's passing. It was a pleasure working with him while we were at CHYM! He brought class and leadership to the place. Such sad news! We hope the memories will offer comfort to you in the days to come. Trudy and Joe Pavia

S

Sharon Pooley posted a condolence

Janice and family, We were so sad to hear the news about Mike's passing. We have a special place in our hearts for Mike as Perry lived with Mike at Ohio State and Mike was responsible for introducing us to one another, We cherish our friendship and the many fun moments we got to experience with Mike. Mike was always there to support his friends and his love for you and your family was inspiring. We also loved his sense of humor and his laugh was one of a kind. He would light up a room with his kindness. Mike will always hold a very special place in our hearts. Our prayers are with you and may God provide you comfort during this time of loss. in sympathy, Sharon and Perry Pooley

Please wait

L

Linda lit a candle

//s3.amazonaws.com/skins.funeraltechweb.com/tribute-gestures/v2/candles/material_candle_white.jpg

Janice and family. No words can tell you the heartbreak we felt when we heard of Mike’s illness and now his passing. He had a laugh that would makes others laugh. Although we didn’t get together often, you were always thought of. We have shared some fun times through hockey, and getting together with our Waterloo friends. In the last month of mike’s life, he told me “ if I can make it through your roast beef dinner, I can make it through this!” He never lost his sense of humour. Please know that we loved Mike and memories we shared with both of you will remain in our hearts forever. God Bless you all and we pray for strength. Marc and Linda Thiel

Please wait

Our sincere condolences to the Blake family. Mike was a great person and a true gentleman. Our thoughts and prayers are with you at this difficult time. Best regards, Jody Pfaff and family

K

Kyle OMalley posted a condolence

I had the pleasure of working with Mike at the Advanced Hockey Clinic held in the summers in Kitchener. He was like a big brother to me, he was so kind was this OSU/NHL goalie. He brought me a OSU jersey one summer and some football practice jerseys as well. I played some golf with him but my most favorite memory of Mike is when he was back in town from playing in the NHL and he had one of those super hot new camero’s. I was drooling over it, he threw me the keys and said take it for the day…I was 16 years old and drove that car around town like I was the man!!! I remember pulling in our driveway at home, I went inside and my mom said your home early, and I said ya because I bought myself a car…you should have seen her face when she walked outside. She thought Mike was such a special person, and she was 100% correct. Rest in peace good buddy, I still have those jerseys and the memory of my ride for a day will be with me forever - Go Bucks and Go Blue.

Jon Beauchesne posted a condolence

Janice, Meaghan, Chris, Nathalie & the entire Blake family. The news of Mikes illness and now his sudden passing leaves me with no words :( I would suggest that we all strive to be the person Mike was and leave the indelible memories he leaves us....as they are plentiful :) The Beauchesne Family pass along our collective condolences & thoughts with Mike's passing

Don and Cheri Voll uploaded photo(s)

/public-file/6822/Ultra/3dc8b98f-a7db-4230-bbe5-dc7118677b59.jpg

/public-file/6823/Ultra/584dfda1-9d15-4250-abcc-16813d6462e3.jpg

Dear Janice and family .... we are saddened to read of Mike's passing. He truly was a genuinely nice guy, always a kind word and sincere smiles and those contagious laughs! We reminisce about the fun times we had with you and Mike while at CHYM. We found a couple photos from our trip to Tuscon, Arizona in 1994. Great memories will live on and hope these memories carry you all through difficult days ahead. hugs from Don and Cheri (Rosie) Voll

Jerry & Barb Saunders posted a condolence

The Saunders family have many great memories of Mike playing hockey and ball in Waterloo. We were greatly saddened to hear of his passing. Our sincere condolences to all the family. RIP Mike

J

Jane and Peter Jamieson posted a condolence

Peter and I have many great memories of the CHYM trips to sunny south destinations, and Mike was such a great host. We always enjoyed catching up with Mike (and Janice) usually at school events as our kids and your kids grew up. Mike was a wonderful person, and led a well lived life. We're very sorry for your family's loss.

Please wait

S

Shaun Levy posted a symbolic gesture

//s3.amazonaws.com/skins.funeraltechweb.com/tribute-gestures/v2/golf.png

What an incredible man. I’ll never forget the first time we met. Strong hand shake. 4 beers later Mike made me carve the Blake Thanksgiving Turkey. The pressure was great but Mike helped me laugh it off along the way. My first Turkey Carving but wasn’t the last at the Blake residence. Mike, I’ll miss our spontaneous txt messages back and forth. He will be missed dearly but will have a place in my heart forever. To my Blake cousins, aunts, uncles and course mother in law - the Levy’s love you and are always here for you. Rest In Peace my pal, Uncle Mike Blake.

Please wait

P

Paul Tilley lit a candle

//s3.amazonaws.com/skins.funeraltechweb.com/tribute-gestures/v2/candles/material_candle_blue.jpg

I would like to send our heartfelt sadness in hearing of the passing of Mike. Our thoughts and prayers go out to his family and friends. Mike was a special person.I have many memories of my time with Mike at Ohio State. He was a great friend and teammate. In recent years we spent some great times in Niagara Falls at Alumni golf outings. Mike will be missed but not forgotten. I love my Buckeye Brother. Rest in peace my friend. All our love Paul and Lyn Tilley.

Please wait

Our deepest sympathy to the family. We will really miss that big smile when he came to Fergus and stopped at Willy's Chip Wagon for fries & visit .We always had a nice visit and enjoyed seeing him.Will really miss him. Willy & Shirley McCrae ❤
